column4: My unprivileged users are complaining about a missing "shutdown" button. Any suggestions?
afaik it is not bug, but feature
yeah, but this "feature" is adding to my trouble tickets
you can report it as bug on www.launchpad.net and request availability to do that as wishlist request
I googled for it but there is nothing about that, it could be bug too
there is no shutdown and restart buttons I guess then?
damn, I am on Feisty can't reboot to verify that
could not they reboot/shutdown from kdm then? Just suggestion for workaround, I will check this feature/bug in Gutsy when I get there, so I will report bug if necessary
oh, yeah, but that's not good enough for them... they "need" to shutdown from inside a gnome session
if it was a simple permissions change or something, I do it and roll it out to all the clients
I am afraid that it is intentionally, but I suggest you to check gnome-session gconf settings, maybe something is hidden there
also, kdm could be to blame too, not sure though
I started reading the gconf docs before I came here... there's a lot to read
so far I can't find anything in gconf
thanks for checking, man... I appreciate the interest
